excerpt: If you're eager to crack the NYT Strands puzzle for December 16, 2024, then here are the hints and answers that can help you do so!

text: Finding it hard to solve the NYT Strands edition for December 16, 2024? You can crack today’s hard theme through the hints we have, which will make locating the answers much easier. Featured in the New York Times, Strands is an unconventional game that allows you to embark on a word search in any direction. Each puzzle has a central theme, which upon finding, makes word finding convenient. It also has a concept of spangram, a word or two, which is an eventual description of the theme, found on opposing sides of the grid. So, without any further ado, here are hints and answers for today’s NYT Strands puzzle. Strands hint and theme for December 16 Here’s the theme and hint for the December 16 puzzle to aid you in an easier word search: Today’s theme is Crossed Words. Theme’s hint: A term that combines the meaning of two different words while also merging their sounds. In short, combinations of two words made one. What are the Strands answers for today, December 16? Here is today’s spangram theme for the December 16, 2024, NYT Strands. Also below is a list of words for you to find and an official theme for spangram. Spangram Theme: PORTMANTEAUX The ‘P’ is placed in the fourth column and winds down to the similar column’s last row. Today’s spangram theme is Portmanteaux, which means adding or combining two words or qualities into one. Today’s word list is as follows: ATHLEISURE (Athletics and leisure) – The ‘A’ is located in the last of the third row and ends in a similar column. ZORSES (Zebras and horses) – The ‘Z’ is the first column’s second letter and the word forms in a triangular direction. ANKLET (Ankle and bracelet) – The ‘A’ can be located in the second column’s last and is completed in a triangular direction again. BRUNCH (Breakfast and lunch)- The ‘B’ is in the sixth row and the word can be formed in a rectangular manner. SPORK (Spoon and fork)- The ‘S’ is placed in the fourth column. SMOG (Smoke and fog)- The ‘S’ is in the first column and its last alphabet can be found in the second column.
html:
Finding it hard to solve the NYT Strands edition for December 16, 2024? You can crack today’s hard theme through the hints we have, which will make locating the answers much easier. Featured in the New York Times, Strands is an unconventional game that allows you to embark on a word search in any direction. Each puzzle has a central theme, which upon finding, makes word finding convenient. It also has a concept of spangram, a word or two, which is an eventual description of the theme, found on opposing sides of the grid.

So, without any further ado, here are hints and answers for today’s NYT Strands puzzle.

Strands hint and theme for December 16

Here’s the theme and hint for the December 16 puzzle to aid you in an easier word search:

Today’s theme is Crossed Words.

Theme’s hint: A term that combines the meaning of two different words while also merging their sounds. In short, combinations of two words made one.

What are the Strands answers for today, December 16?

Here is today’s spangram theme for the December 16, 2024, NYT Strands. Also below is a list of words for you to find and an official theme for spangram.

Spangram Theme: PORTMANTEAUX

  • The ‘P’ is placed in the fourth column and winds down to the similar column’s last row.
  • Today’s spangram theme is Portmanteaux, which means adding or combining two words or qualities into one.

Today’s word list is as follows:

  • ATHLEISURE (Athletics and leisure) – The ‘A’ is located in the last of the third row and ends in a similar column.
  • ZORSES (Zebras and horses) – The ‘Z’ is the first column’s second letter and the word forms in a triangular direction.
  • ANKLET (Ankle and bracelet) – The ‘A’ can be located in the second column’s last and is completed in a triangular direction again.
  • BRUNCH (Breakfast and lunch)- The ‘B’ is in the sixth row and the word can be formed in a rectangular manner.
  • SPORK (Spoon and fork)- The ‘S’ is placed in the fourth column.
  • SMOG (Smoke and fog)- The ‘S’ is in the first column and its last alphabet can be found in the second column.
